name: hard coal preparation | hard coal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19089/documentation

Coal is the most important and abundant fossil fuel in India. It accounts for 55% of the country's;energy need.;Coal Preparation: The high ash content in coal can be reduced to a desired level by simple washing processes. The use of;washed coal having lower ash content and higher heat value in power generation results in more;efficient combustion; reduced CO2 emissions and other economic benefits for the generating;company;A coal preparation plant (CPP) is a facility which washes coal of soil and rock, crushes it into graded sized chunks (sorting), stockpiles grades preparing. A CPP may also be called a coal handling and preparation plant (CHPP), The more of this waste material that can be removed from coal, and lower its total ash content. The greater its;market value and lower its transportation costs.;The total installed capacity of washeries in india 131.24 million tonnes per year.;Coal India Limited  operates 15 washeies in India with installed capacity of 36.8 Million tonnes per annum;ACB (India) Limited, along with its subsidiaries and associates,  is largest and most efficient coal washery company in the private sector with an aggregate designed beneficiation capacity, on a proportional basis, of 65.61 million tons per annum;The total production of washed coal or prepared coal is only 23.301 million tonnes which is very less when compared to overall production of coal from coal mines (639.234 million tonnes). This shows that very less quantity of coal is being used in preparation plants and most of the coal is directly used from coal mines;The values for emissions to air and water (waste water quantityt is included in the dataset) have not been covered in this dataset. The emission values for coal mining in india have been taken from the global datsets which cover both the mining as well as preparation , hence to avoid any kind of double accounting the same have not been used in this dataset.

Activity begins with 1 kg hard coal (run of mine) at the coal preparation plant. Only inputs have been included in the datasets. The emissions (other than that of waste water) have been included in the hard coal mine operation datasets because these could not be separated out from the global estimated which were used for the datasets becuase of unavailability of India specific emissions.

Activity ends with production of 1 kg of washed coal at coal washery
category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data is collected over the years 2006-2016. The data has been collected from various environmental statements of various coal washeries in India. Some of the other publically available documents like provisional coal statistics 2015 - 16 have been used for collection of data required for the dataset
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The major washeries in india are located in the states of Jharkhund , Chattisgarh
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data presented here represents the current technology levels for coal preparation in the country.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data was collected from environmental statements of 4 coal washeries in India. The name of the four washeries which have been used for data collection are Kedla washery, West Bokaro washery, Bheltand washery and Jamadoba washery. Some of the exchanges like Middling, Coal Slurry, Tailings, Annionic resin, Chemical organic have been taken from only one washery. Exchange of water and magnetite has representation from all four washeries. The same have been mentioned in the comments and pedigree has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: The hard coal from mine includes the total hard coal produced from washing process as well as the middlings produced during the process. The middlings have been merged with the main product by averaging the properties for the same, Further the other remaining exchanges scaled down accordingly.

flow.name: hard coal
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal

exchanges.description: Own Assumption (15 % of water after water balance is considered to be evaporated to air) and rermaining is taken as discharge as water

Literature Data: The data is collected from environment statements of 3 coal washeries  namely - Bheltand Coal Washery , Jamadoba Coal Washery , West Bokaro (washery -2). Magnetite per ton of hard coal prepared was given in the respective environment statements

exchanges.description: Literature Data: The data is collected from environment statements of coal washeries West Bokaro (washery -2). The chemical organic here is used as frother in the process. The common chemical used here is methyl isobutyl carbinol. It is also called as MIBC. MIBC is used as a frother in the flotation process in the mining of coal.

exchanges.description: Litreature data: The electricity consumption required for coal preparation has been taken from a pre-feasibility report of 2.5MTPA coal washery (company name - Hind Energy and Coal Benefication (India) Ltd.). The mentioned document states the specific power consumption as 5 units per ton of raw coal throughput. The report can be downloaded from the following link: http://environmentclearance.nic.in/writereaddata/Online/TOR/09_May_2017_103150000E0QK6WFBPrefeasibilityReportHindEnergyJharsuguda.pdf
